questions.title: Count Words With Special Separator
questions.description:
You are given a sentence s that may contain alphabets, digits, and special characters, including multiple separators such as spaces, periods (.), commas (,), hyphens (-), and slashes (/). Your task is to count how many valid English words exist in the sentence. A valid word contains only lowercase English letters. Consecutive separators should not incorrectly create empty 'words'.

Example: 'hello-world/ai' contains 2 valid words: 'hello' and 'ai'.
Words like 'abc123', '9live', 'dog!' are invalid because they contain non-letter characters.
questions.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 200000
String may contain: [a-z], digits, spaces, '.', ',', '-', '/', '!'.
hints: Split using all special chars: use regex or manual scan
Check each token contains only letters

questions.title: Find Longest Consecutive Increasing Subarray
questions.description:
Given an array of integers arr, find the length of the longest strictly increasing continuous subarray. A continuous subarray means the elements appear consecutively in the array without skipping.

Example: In [3, 4, 5, 1, 2, 3, 10], the longest increasing continuous subarray is [1, 2, 3, 10] with length 4.
This problem is good for testing scanning logic, edge cases, and large input performance.
hints: Use a sliding window or one-pass scan

questions.title: Remove Adjacent Duplicates Repeatedly
questions.description:
Given a string s, remove all adjacent duplicate characters repeatedly until no more duplicates remain. This problem tests stack/string-manipulation and is large enough to stress parsing logic.

Example: 'abbaca' → remove 'bb' → 'aaca' → remove 'aa' → 'ca'.
questions.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 200000
Contains lowercase English letters only.
hints: Pop when top equals current character

questions.title: Longest Balanced Binary Substring
questions.description:
You are given a binary string s of '0' and '1'. A balanced substring is one where the number of 0s equals the number of 1s AND all 0s come before all 1s.

Example: In '00111011', the substring '0011' is balanced (two 0s, two 1s). Find the maximum length among all such substrings.
This problem stresses string scanning, counts, and boundary logic.

questions.title: Sum of Subarray Minimums
questions.description:
You are given an array arr. For every possible contiguous subarray, find the minimum element. Return the sum of all these minimums.

Example: For arr = [3,1,2,4], all subarrays and their minimums are: [3]=3, [3,1]=1, [3,1,2]=1, [3,1,2,4]=1, [1]=1, [1,2]=1, [1,2,4]=1, [2]=2, [2,4]=2, [4]=4 → sum = 17.
This is a large monotonic-stack problem that fully tests performance and backend parsing.
